intro: Pitcairnia chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí pitcairnia, is a striking bromeliad native to Central America. It is characterized by its tall, upright rosette of sword-shaped leaves that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces striking red or orange inflorescences that emerge from the center of the rosette. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in botanical studies.
